intro: Aria tsinlingensis, commonly known as the Tsingling bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and is adapted to temperate climates. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in summer. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
